fields.text: What is the patient's age (in years)
fields.help_text: Please enter the patient's age to the nearest 10 years if not known.

fields.text: The patient is:
What is the patient's primary respiratory diagnosis?
In which country are you based?
I agree that data submitted may be analysed as part of the research of the PRPP.
Do you know the name of your lung disease?
Has a doctor or nurse told you how this disease affects your lungs?
Has a doctor or nurse told you what is likely to happen in the future?
Which of the following statements best describes what will happen to you over the next few years?

fields.label: Now that my disease is being treated, I will probably get better
Now that my disease is being treated, I will probably stay the same

fields.text: Has a doctor or nurse explained the reason for taking your inhalers or medicines?
Do you try to take your inhalers or medicines exactly as you have been instructed by a doctor or nurse?
Are you satisfied with the information doctors and nurses have given you about your inhalers or medicines?

fields.label: I understand everything I need to know
I understand what I have been told but I would like to know more
I am slightly confused about my medicines
I am very confused about my medicines

fields.text: What sentence best describes what you have been told to do if your breathing gets worse (e.g., take two puffs instead of one)?

fields.label: I have been told what to do and the doctor/nurse has given me written instructions
I have been told but it is not written on paper
I haven't been told but I know what to do
I haven't been told and I don’t know what to do

fields.text: Have you been told when you should call an ambulance if your breathing worsens?

fields.label: I have been told what to do and the doctor/nurse has given me written instructions
I have been told but it isn't written on paper
I haven't been told but I know what to do
I haven't been told and I am uncertain when an ambulance should be called

fields.text: What best describes you?

fields.label: Used to smoke but don't now  (skip the next 2 questions)

fields.text: Has a doctor or nurse advised you to give up smoking?
Has a doctor or nurse offered to help you to give up smoking (e.g., given you nicotine gum or patches or referral to a Smoking Cessation clinic)?
Have you been told by a doctor or nurse to try to do some physical activity (e.g., walking, brisk walking and other forms of exercise)?
Has a doctor or nurse told you how much physical activity (e.g., walking, brisk walking and other forms of exercise) you should do?

fields.label: Yes and I know what to do
Yes but I am unsure what to do
Yes but I am unable to do it

fields.text: How much physical activity do you do?

fields.label: I push myself as much as I can

fields.text: What have doctors or nurses told you about your diet or eating?

fields.label: Eat several small meals per day "(e.g., 6 small meals per day instead of 3 large ones)

fields.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Poor appetite or overeating?
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way?
Have you any questions or comments about your lung disease? "If so, write them in the space below"
